abstract: Failure of CoOportunity Health raises questions about the viability of some 23 nonprofit cooperatives created under the Affordable Care Act to generate competition for traditional insurers; organization became a victim of its own success, attracting 120,000 customers in Iowa and Nebraska that brought with them an unexpectedly high level of health costs; CoOportunity customers are now scrambling to find new insurance.
lead_paragraph: The insolvency of CoOportunity Health raised the question of whether a major Affordable Care Act experiment in holding down insurance costs was in trouble beyond Iowa and Nebraska.

headline.main: Health Care Success for Midwest Co-op Proves Its Undoing
headline.print_headline: Health Care Success for Midwest Co-op Proves Its Undoing

snippet: The insolvency of CoOportunity Health raised the question of whether a major Affordable Care Act experiment in holding down insurance costs was in trouble beyond Iowa and Nebraska.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
